intro: Tillaea manaia, commonly known as the Maori rock cress, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in New Zealand. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often succulent, helping it retain moisture in arid conditions. Tillaea manaia plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to soil stability and providing food for local wildlife.
